intro: Hieracium pallidum subsp. argaeum, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It has alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Its subspecies status reflects subtle morphological differences from the main species, making it a subject of taxonomic interest.
